section.title: Detailed Description
section.para: The Controller class.
Defines the Controller class that contains the main functionality of the spell checker.

section.title: addMask()

para.para: Replaces the [*] contained input with a mask from the tokeniser.

entry.para: The complete input given by the user

section.para: Definition at line 84 of file Controller.py.
section.programlisting: 00084 def addMask(self, input): 00085 """! Replaces the [*] contained input with a mask from the tokeniser. 00086 @param input The complete input given by the user 00087 """ 00088 mask = self.tokenizer.mask_token 00089 input = regex.sub("[[A-Za-z]+]", mask, input) 00090 return input 00091

section.title: extractPreAndPost()

para.para: Returns the word before the error and the next word after the error.

entry.para: The complete input given by the user

section.para: Definition at line 122 of file Controller.py.
section.programlisting: 00122 def extractPreAndPost(self, input): 00123 """! Returns the word before the error and the next word after the error. 00124 @param input The complete input given by the user 00125 """ 00126 beforeAndAfter = input.split("[" + str(self.contextError) + "]") 00127 before = beforeAndAfter[0] 00128 after = beforeAndAfter[1] 00129 pre, post = "", "" 00130 if len(before) > 2: 00131 pre = before.split(" ")[-2] 00132 if pre[:-1] == ",": 00133 post = post[:-1] 00134 if len(after) > 2: 00135 post = after.split(" ")[1] 00136 for char in post: 00137 if char in "?.!/;:": 00138 post = post.replace(char, "") 00139 return pre, post 00140

section.title: extractWord()

para.para: Returns only the contents of [*] contained within the input given by the user.

entry.para: The complete input given by the user

section.para: Definition at line 116 of file Controller.py.
section.programlisting: 00116 def extractWord(self, input): 00117 """! Returns only the contents of [*] contained within the input given by the user. 00118 @param input The complete input given by the user 00119 """ 00120 return input[input.find("[") + 1 : input.find("]")] 00121

section.title: getEditDistance()

para.para: Returns the edit distance between the original word and the string compared.

entry.para: The original word given by the user
The string to be compared to the original word

section.para: Definition at line 141 of file Controller.py.
section.programlisting: 00141 def getEditDistance(self, originalWord, stringCompared): 00142 """! Returns the edit distance between the original word and the string compared. 00143 @param originalWord The original word given by the user 00144 @param stringCompared The string to be compared to the original word 00145 """ 00146 if len(originalWord) < len(stringCompared): 00147 return self.getEditDistance(stringCompared, originalWord) 00148 # When the originalWord is longer than the word to be compared with 00149 if len(stringCompared) == 0: 00150 return len(originalWord) 00151 previousRow = range(len(stringCompared) + 1) 00152 for originalWordindex, charOne in enumerate(originalWord): 00153 currentRow = [originalWordindex + 1] 00154 for comparedWordIndex, charTwo in enumerate(stringCompared): 00155 insertions = previous_row[comparedWordIndex + 1] + 1 00156 deletions = currentRow[comparedWordIndex] + 1 00157 substitutions = previous_row[comparedWordIndex] + (charOne != charTwo) 00158 currentRow.append(min(insertions, deletions, substitutions)) 00159 previous_row = currentRow 00160 return previous_row[-1] 00161

section.title: getEditDistanceList()

para.para: Returns a list of the all potential words with the edit distances between the potential word and the original error.

section.para: Definition at line 162 of file Controller.py.
section.programlisting: 00162 def getEditDistanceList(self): 00163 """! Returns a list of the all potential words with the edit distances between the potential word and the original error.""" 00164 synsetList = self.modelResultsSynset 00165 originalWord = self.contextError 00166 editDistances = [] 00167 for word in synsetList: 00168 distance = self.shortGetEditDistance(originalWord, word) 00169 editDistances.append(distance) 00170 combinedList = list(zip(synsetList, editDistances)) 00171 return combinedList 00172

section.title: getSynsets()

para.para: Loads and Returns the model for use by the program from hugginface.com.

section.para: Definition at line 187 of file Controller.py.
section.programlisting: 00187 def getSynsets(self, guessedWords): 00188 """! Loads and Returns the model for use by the program from hugginface.com. 00189 @param guessedWords A list of potential Guesses 00190 """ 00191 guesses = set() 00192 wordList = set() 00193 for guess in guessedWords: 00194 guesses.add(guess) 00195 for guess in guesses: 00196 wordList.add(guess) 00197 synsets = self.wordNet.synsets(guess) 00198 for synset in synsets: 00199 for lemma in synset.lemmas(): 00200 print(str(lemma.name()) + ", ", end=" ") 00201 wordList.add(lemma.name().strip().replace("_", " ").lower()) 00202 return wordList 00203

section.title: processInput()

para.para: Main functionality of the program that processes the input given by the user.

section.para:
@type input: str
Parameters
input
The complete input given by the user
Definition at line 231 of file Controller.py.
section.programlisting: 00231 def processInput(self, input: str): 00232 """! Main functionality of the program that processes the input given by the user. 00233 @type input: str 00234 @param input The complete input given by the user 00235 """ 00236 if self.containsError(input): 00237 # gets the word that is the error 00238 self.contextError = self.extractWord(input) 00239 # get word before the error and after the error 00240 self.preWord, self.postWord = self.extractPreAndPost(input) 00241 # replaces the error with an appropriate mask 00242 self.maskedInput = self.addMask(input) 00243 # get the model predictions 00244 self.modelResults = self.getModelPredictions(self.maskedInput) 00245 self.modelResultsSynset = [] 00246 # for each prediction made: 00247 for prediction in self.modelResults: 00248 # gets the predicted word 00249 prediction = prediction.get("token_str").strip() 00250 # creates a list of three words to create two bigrams for comparison 00251 bigramRawInputList = [] 00252 bigramRawInputList.append(self.preWord) 00253 bigramRawInputList.append(prediction) 00254 bigramRawInputList.append(self.postWord) 00255 bigramList = list(nltk.bigrams(bigramRawInputList)) 00256 bigramJoinedList = [] 00257 # joins words with a space for each bigram 00258 for bigram in bigramList: 00259 bigram = " ".join(bigram) 00260 bigramJoinedList.append(bigram) 00261 bigramFinalList = bigramJoinedList[:] 00262 bigramFinalList.append(prediction) 00263 # gets the synsets for each bigram in the list 00264 bigramListResults = self.getSynsets(bigramFinalList) 00265 # Filter out the bigrams only 00266 for word in list(bigramListResults): 00267 for bigram in bigramJoinedList: 00268 if word == bigram: 00269 bigramListResults.remove(word) 00270 # appends the synsets to the full list of synsets 00271 for result in bigramListResults: 00272 self.modelResultsSynset.append(result) 00273 00274 # Filter out any duplicates that may be present 00275 self.modelResultsSynset = list(set(self.modelResultsSynset)) 00276 # returns a set of lists that adds the edit distance to each word in the set 00277 self.editDistances = self.getEditDistanceList() 00278 # sorts the list according to the edit distance in ascending order 00279 self.sortEditDistances() 00280 # Return the top 10 results by shortest edit distance compared to the error 00281 return self.editDistances[:10] 00282 else: 00283 pass 00284

section.title: shortGetEditDistance()

para.para: Gets the edit distance required to change strignCompared into original Word using the levenshtein method.

entry.para: The word to be compared to
The word to be compared to the original word

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: The edit distance between the two words

section.para: Definition at line 285 of file Controller.py.
section.programlisting: 00285 def shortGetEditDistance(self, originalWord, stringCompared): 00286 """! Gets the edit distance required to change strignCompared into original Word using the levenshtein method 00287 @param originalWord The word to be compared to 00288 @param stringCompared The word to be compared to the original word 00289 @return The edit distance between the two words 00290 """ 00291 originalWord = originalWord.lower() 00292 stringCompared = stringCompared.lower() 00293 distance = leven.distance(originalWord, stringCompared) 00294 return distance 00295
